ee.sk.digidoc
Class DataFile

java.lang.Object
  ee.sk.digidoc.DataFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class DataFile
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Represents a DataFile instance, that either contains payload data or references and external DataFile.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Veiko Sinivee
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

DataFile

public DataFile(java.lang.String id,
                java.lang.String contentType,
                java.lang.String fileName,
                java.lang.String mimeType,
                SignedDoc sdoc)
         throws DigiDocException
Creates new DataFile

Parameters:
id - id of the DataFile
contenType - DataFile content type
fileName - original file name (without path!)
mimeType - contents mime type
sdoc - parent object
Throws:
DigiDocException - for validation errors
Method Detail

getBody

public byte[] getBody()
Accessor for body attribute. Note that the body is normally NOT LOADED from file and this attribute is empty!

Returns:
value of body attribute

setBody

public void setBody(byte[] data)
Mutator for body attribute. For any bigger files don't use this method! If you are using very small messages onthe other hand then this might speed things up. This method should not be publicly used to assign data to body. If you do then you must also set the initial codepage and size of body!

Parameters:
data - new value for body attribute

getBodyAsString

public java.lang.String getBodyAsString()
                                 throws DigiDocException
Accessor for body attribute. Returns the body as a string. Takes in account the initial codepage. usable only for EMBEDDED type of documents.

Returns:
body as string
Throws:
DigiDocException

getBodyAsData

public byte[] getBodyAsData()
Accessor for body attribute. Returns the body as a byte array. If body contains embedded base64 data then this is decoded first and decoded actual payload data returned.

Returns:
body as a byte array

setBody

public void setBody(byte[] data,
                    java.lang.String codepage)
Use this method to assign data directly to body. If you do this then the input file will not be read. This also sets the initial size and codepage for you

Parameters:
data - new value for body attribute

setBody

public void setBody(org.w3c.dom.Node xml)
             throws DigiDocException
Use this method to assign data directly to body. Input data is an XML subtree

Parameters:
xml - xml subtree containing input data
codepage - input data's original codepage
Throws:
DigiDocException

getInitialCodepage

public java.lang.String getInitialCodepage()
Accessor for initialCodepage attribute.

Returns:
value of initialCodepage attribute

setInitialCodepage

public void setInitialCodepage(java.lang.String data)
Mutator for initialCodepage attribute. If you use setBody() or assign data from a file which is not in UTF-8 and then use CONTENT_EMBEDDED then you must use this method to tell the library in which codepage your data is so that we can convert it to UTF-8.

Parameters:
data - new value for initialCodepage attribute

validate

public java.util.ArrayList validate(boolean bStrong)
Helper method to validate the whole DataFile object

Parameters:
bStrong - flag that specifies if Id atribute value is to be rigorously checked (according to digidoc format) or only as required by XML-DSIG
Returns:
a possibly empty list of DigiDocException objects

calculateFileSizeAndDigest

public void calculateFileSizeAndDigest(java.io.OutputStream os)
                                throws DigiDocException
Calculates the DataFiles size and digest Since it calculates the digest of the external file then this is only useful for detatched files

Throws:
DigiDocException - for all errors
